title: Phase 2 Complete - Resilience Features
content:
Successfully completed Phase 2: Reliability (Gaps 1 & 2 of test-to-prod implementation).

**Gap 1: Storage-Based Fallback (16 tests)**
- Automatic fallback when BroadcastChannel unavailable
- storage.onChanged listener for message propagation
- Storage-based broadcasting with timestamp keys
- Periodic cleanup (5s TTL)

**Gap 2: Error Recovery & Reconnection (17 tests)**
- Health tracking (lastSuccessfulSend, consecutiveFailures)
- Automatic reconnection after 3 failures
- Exponential backoff: 100ms, 500ms, 2s, 5s, 5s
- Error event emission (broadcast:error)
- Manual channel health test
- Falls back to storage after 5 failed reconnections
- Timer cleanup on close

**Total Phase 2:** 33 tests passing

**Key Design Decisions:**
- FAILURE_THRESHOLD = 3 (trigger reconnection)
- MAX_RECONNECTION_ATTEMPTS = 5 (switch to fallback)
- Exponential backoff prevents overwhelming system
- Health test uses __PING__ message
- Error events include failure count and timestamp

**Self-Healing Architecture:**
1. Track health: lastSuccessfulSend, consecutiveFailures, isChannelHealthy
2. Detect failures: Increment failure count on error
3. Trigger recovery: Schedule reconnection at threshold
4. Exponential backoff: Prevent rapid reconnection attempts
5. Ultimate fallback: Switch to storage after max attempts

**Next:** Phase 3 - Observability (Gaps 7 & 4)

**Total Progress:** 92 tests (Phase 1: 59 + Phase 2: 33)
